newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Date set for war crimes trial of Croat General.
newsitem.headline: Date set for war crimes trial of Croat General.

text.p: The long-delayed war crimes trial of Croat General Tihomir Blaskic will begin on June 23 in the Hague, the International Criminal Tribunal for the Former Yugoslavia said on Friday.
Blaskic gave himself up to the U.N. warcrimes body over a year ago, but his trial has been delayed by wrangling between the tribunal, Bosnia and Croatia over evidence.
He has pleaded not guilty to responsibility for war crimes committed against Moslems when he was commander of Bosnian Croat militia forces in the Lasva valley region of Bosnia in 1992 and 1993.
Blaskic was promoted to a senior post in Croatia's regular army after his indictment by the Hague-based tribunal.
